meanings.definition: Obtain (something) by devious or cunning methods.
meanings.sent1: He wangled his way into the party by pretending to be a friend of the host.
meanings.sent2: She wangled a free ticket to the concert by claiming she was the performer's cousin.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat wangled extra treats from its owner by pretending to be hungry all the time.
meanings.sent4: The sly fox wangled its escape from the zoo by outsmarting the guards.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous child wangled a toy from the store by distracting the salesperson.

meanings.definition: Manage to achieve (something) by clever or deceitful methods.
meanings.sent1: He wangled a promotion at work by flattering his boss.
meanings.sent2: She wangled her way out of doing chores by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent3: The student wangled a passing grade on the test by copying from a classmate.
meanings.sent4: The magician wangled a rabbit out of the hat to the amazement of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The con artist wangled money from unsuspecting victims by pretending to be a wealthy investor.
